To answer the research question which test should be used with how many
degrees of freedom?

Answerlist
----------
* A t-test with 2 degrees of freedom
* A t-test with 149 degrees of freedom
* A chi-square test with 2 degrees of freedom
* A chi-square test with 149 degrees of freedom

Solution
========





Here you have a categorical association. The test you have to do is the
chi-square test, a *t* -test is for comparing two groups, here you have
a categorical association.  
  
  
Degrees of freedom= (number of rows-1)(number of columns-1) =
(2-1)(3-1)=1\*2=2.  
  
  
If you want to know more about categorical associations watch
this [clip](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j2ACVQBkKfY&index=1&list=PLyLpEs0x9BnkqWS0k674CckSeAeJ4A3W7)  
  
  
If you want to know more about the chi-square test and degrees of
freedom watch this
[clip](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=izw6vGctckA&index=2&list=PLyLpEs0x9BnkqWS0k674CckSeAeJ4A3W7)
